intro: Verbascum sublobatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Verbascum sublobatum is also valued for its medicinal properties, with historical uses in treating respiratory ailments.
